info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 16 at 8:11AM CDT until June 17 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
Roubidoux Creek Near Waynesville affecting Pulaski County.
For the Roubidoux Creek...including Waynesville...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Roubidoux Creek near Waynesville.
* WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the RV Park on the west side of Roubidoux in Waynesville just north of the Business 66 bridge floods. Spring Road near I-44 floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 2.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 9.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 4.2 feet Thursday morning. It will rise to 4.3 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 03/20/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 815 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY EVENING
